abstract: Three U.S. private equity firms are on a shortlist to submit final bids for Morgan Stanley’s $1 billion plus stake in China’s top investment bank, three sources briefed on the bidding process told Reuters on Tuesday.
snippet: Three U.S. private equity firms are on a shortlist to submit final bids for Morgan Stanley’s $1 billion plus stake in China’s top investment bank, three sources briefed on the bidding process told Reuters on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: Three American private equity firms are on a short list to submit final bids for Morgan Stanley‘s $1 billion-plus stake in China’s top investment bank, three sources briefed on the bidding process told Reuters on Tuesday.

headline.main: Buyout Shops Said to Be in Race for China Bank Stake

abstract: Huatai Securities, the mid-sized Chinese brokerage, will launch an initial public offering in Shanghai this week that could raise $2.4 billion in China’s largest offering this year, braving a mainland market straining under heavy new share offerings and tightening liquidity.
snippet: Huatai Securities, the mid-sized Chinese brokerage, will launch an initial public offering in Shanghai this week that could raise $2.4 billion in China’s largest offering this year, braving a mainland market straining under heavy new share offerin...
lead_paragraph: Huatai Securities, the mid-sized Chinese brokerage firm, will introduce an initial public offering in Shanghai this week that could raise 16.5 billion renminbi ($2.4 billion) in China’s largest offering this year, braving a mainland market straining under a large number of new share offerings and tightening liquidity, Reuters reported.

headline.main: China Brokerage Firm’s I.P.O. Aims for $2.4 Billion

abstract: A clutch of Western banks that have escaped the worst of the financial crisis are seizing the opportunity to ramp up their presence in China in the hope of profiting from the sector’s rapid growth, Reuters reported.
snippet: A clutch of Western banks that have escaped the worst of the financial crisis are seizing the opportunity to ramp up their presence in China in the hope of profiting from the sector’s rapid growth, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Several Western banks that have escaped the worst of the financial crisis are seizing the opportunity to increase their presence in China in the hope of profiting from the sector’s rapid growth, Reuters reported.

headline.main: For the Unscathed Banks, China Beckons
